title: Cannes 2023: Russian filmmaker Ilya Povolotsky' journey of art and opposition
description: The director, who came to present 'Grace' at the Directors' Fortnight, talks about his country under Putin and his desire 'to observe reality and look for answers.'

title: In Nicaragua, the Ortega-Murillo regime's intensifying repression
description: The autocratic Nicaraguan government of Daniel Ortega has increased surveillance of its opponents, forcing many into exile.

title: Tina Turner, the Queen of Rock'n'Roll, has died
description: Over a career spanning seven decades, the R&B star left an indelible mark. She died on Wednesday, May 24, at the age of 83.

title: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis launches 2024 bid
description: The 44-year-old Republican revealed his decision in a Federal Election Commission filing. He was set to hold an online conversation with Twitter chief executive Elon Musk later on Wednesday.

title: Violence risks 'decivilizing' France, Macron warns
description: The French president's remarks came after a series of violent sequels in the country including an arson attack on a mayor's home in March.

title: French government wants homeless out of Paris ahead of 2024 Olympics
description: The government began asking officials around the country to set up "temporary regional accommodation facilities" that could handle an outflux of homeless people.

title: Lebanon slaps travel ban on central bank chief wanted by France
description: Riad Salameh has been the target of a series of judicial investigations both at home and abroad on allegations including fraud, money laundering and illicit enrichment.

title: Turkey elections: The across-the-board triumph of nationalists
description: In the majority and the opposition, nationalists have become indispensable partners, succeeding in shifting the political spectrum toward an increasingly polarized discourse.

title: 'The Little Mermaid': Disney embraces kitschy nostalgia
description: Actress Halle Bailey, who was targeted by racist attacks, is convincing in this film that is especially notable for the fantasy world it creates with outrageous effects.

title: Mahsa Amini's grave vandalized in Iran, says family lawyer
description: Mahsa Amini's death after being arrested by Tehran's morality police in September 2022 sparked protests challenging the Islamic system that has ruled Iran since the 1979 revolution.

title: Quadriplegic walks again thanks to device connecting his brain to his muscles
description: According to a case study published in 'Nature,' a Swiss team, with the help of a French research center, has developed a brain-machine interface that helps this patient to transform his intentions of movement into actual muscle contractions.

title: Tariq Ramadan's acquittal: The court faced 'insurmountable doubt'
description: After the judgment on Wednesday, the plaintiff's lawyers immediately said that their client was appealing 'an unjust decision, taken at the end of a caricatured hearing where dignity was absent.'

title: The US faces default: Five questions about the debt ceiling
description: More serious than a shutdown, the possibility that the United States will be unable to repay its loans has the markets worried. According to the Treasury, Republican and Democratic lawmakers have until June 1 to reach an agreement.

title: Ukraine arranges troops in battle order for counteroffensive
description: To conduct its reconquest operation in the country's east, Kyiv has set up special brigades of volunteers while boosting its regular forces, many of which benefited from NATO training.

title: Cannes 2023: 'The Delinquents,' a very successful robbery by Rodrigo Moreno
description: A bank employee steals from his employer as part of a plan to live out the rest of his life with no money worries. A great film tinged with burlesque.

title: Facing fines from Brussels, Fret SNCF to be restructured
description: The European Commission is threatening sanctions against Fret SNCF, the freight subsidiary of France's rail operator, because of the government aid it receives. Transport Minister Clément Beaune is proposing reforms to rescue the group, but it will have to give up 20% of its revenue.

title: The French-Ethiopian high school in Addis Ababa, a flagship in decline
description: Suffering from, financial difficulties, falling academic standards, and more frequent incidents, Gébré-Mariam High School has lost its former glory.

title: In the Congo's Ituri region, two villages tell the story of two communities at war
description: Since it resumed in 2017, the conflict in the Democratic Republic of Congo between the Hema and Lendu has left several thousand people dead in the east of the country.

title: Between Cayenne and Paris, cocaine-smuggling 'ants' are under high surveillance
description: With 20% of the cocaine in France allegedly coming from French Guiana, the authorities are trying to thwart mules, the poor people recruited by drug networks to transport the product.

title: Drug trafficking in France: Perpetrators and victims of violence are increasingly younger
description: According to an unpublished report based on a compilation of information from territorial intelligence, just over 60% of the people injured or killed in drug-related shootings from the beginning of 2023 were under the age of 25.

title: ECB turns 25 amid accusations of failing to control inflation
description: As it celebrates its 25th anniversary, the European Central Bank is accused of having failed in its fundamental mission by letting prices get out of hand between late 2021 and early 2022.

title: Mexico's presidential morning routine has reshaped politics and media
description: For the past four and a half years, Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has started his day with a press conference broadcast live on television. He often uses it to attack 'conservatives' and 'corrupt media.'

title: Peter Gabriel creates intimate campfire at Paris concert, between classics and novelties
description: After a nine year's absence, the ex-Genesis singer returned for three concerts in France, including a triumphant first one in Paris on May 23.

title: Islamic scholar Tariq Ramadan cleared of Swiss rape charges
description: The former Oxford University professor was charged with sexually harassing a woman in a Geneval hotel room in 2008. The Swiss court found no evidence against him/

title: Cannes 2023: 'Fallen Leaves' follows two lonely people against backdrop of war in Ukraine
description: The Finnish director’s new tragicomedy is a Chaplin-inspired gem that explores love as a last refuge.

title: Paris homeless families rally to obtain accommodation
description: With emergency housing saturated, a growing number of families are failing to obtain shelter. Some have managed to by occupying the square in front of City Hall.

title: Cannes 2023: 'Asteroid City,' Wes Anderson's latest frontier
description: Kids passionate about flying saucers and soldiers protecting a heavy secret, all in a 50s sitcom setting: The American director presents multiple allusions that fall short of convincing.

title: German police carry out raids targetting seven climate activists
description: Police searched properties and seized accounts belonging to members of the 'Last Generation' group.

title: International Booker Prize announces first Bulgarian winner Gospodinov
description: Praised for capturing the 'extreme fragility of the past,' Georgi Gospodinov’s 'Time Shelter' depicts a clinic that offers experimental Alzheimer's treatment.

title: Paris Olympics 2024: Organizers insist Games will be accessible to all, despite price complaints
description: On Tuesday, the president of the Organizing Committee argued that the ticketing system was 'accessible' – and the 6.8 million tickets sold prove it. There will be a third round of sales this summer.

title: Racism in football: The Vinicius case forces Spain to react
description: Two days after racist insults aimed at the Real Madrid striker, Spain has found itself accused of complacency in the face of entrenched racism in its stadiums.

title: South Carolina Senate passes 6-week abortion ban
description: The only five women in the 46-member chamber all fought against the ban. It will now be sent to the state governor, who says he will sign it.

title: Growth and inequality: A dialogue between Thomas Piketty and Kenneth Pomeranz
description: The French economist and the American historian debated on May 16 in Paris about the complex forces that link economic wealth, distribution and the history of political and social conflicts.

title: NBA: Celtics avoid sweep with victory against Heat
description: The Boston Celtics kept their Eastern Conference finals hopes alive with a 116-99 victory over the Miami Heat on Tuesday to reduce the series deficit to 3-1.

title: The French government opposes the creation of a 'green wealth tax' to combat climate change
description: Instead of creating a new wealth tax that would target the financial assets of the richest 10%, as recently recommended by economist Jean Pisani-Ferry, the government says it prefers making existing taxation 'greener.'

title: Multinational companies payout record-breaking dividends despite economic slowdown
description: Up 12% in the first quarter, total payout to shareholders worldwide continues to ride on soaring profits of listed companies.
